children.text: The roof sarking has not been lapped properly at the ridges and valleys, which will allow condensation to drip onto the ceilings. Additionally, these oversized gaps will allow embers into the roof cavity in the event of a bushfire.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 4200.2 Pliable Building Membranes and Underlays, Part 2: Installation Requirements states that
‘penetrations shall be either sealed or turned up to facilitate drainage around a penetration’ .
Additionally, AS 3959 Construction of Buildings in Bushfire-Prone Areas, states in Section 5.6.5 Roof Penetrations, that

‘Roof penetrations, including roof lights, roof ventilators, roof-mounted evaporative cooling units, aerials, vent pipes and supports for solar collectors, shall be adequately sealed at the roof to prevent gaps greater than 3mm’
These areas must be rectified in accordance with the above requirements.
